page.title: 17EDGCOTT
page.content: Part of the village of{Edgcott}is included in the block. It lies to the east of Marsh Gibbon.It is a small village but it has grown a lot in the last 10 years as new houses have been built. Many years ago it had a school but the building is now used as a {Village Hall.}It has a{Post Office which opens for a limited number of hours each week and a pub which used to be two farm cottages. The old pub is now a farm house. The{Anglican {church}was founded in the{14th {century. Most of the fields between Marsh Gibbon and Edgcott are used for grazing by the farmers of Marsh Gibbon,Charndon and Edgcott. The name of the village has changed over the centuries from{Hochecote}in 1159,{Echecott}in 1223,{Eggecote}in 1550 and Edgcott by 1920.
